intro: Epilobium purpuratum, commonly known as purple willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist habitats such as meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are typically reddish in color. Epilobium purpuratum is often used in traditional herbal medicine and is also a valuable nectar source for pollinators.
